primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The cosmic restoration of humanity and creation through the resurrection of Christ, resulting in the liberation of the dead and the renewal of the living.

subject.identificatie: God / Christ (The King of kings / The Savior)
tekstueel_bewijs: God has taken care to raise the dead
the Lord of the angels has risen
Jesus’ death tore the Temple veil
it is God himself who delights our soul

object.identificatie: The renewal of the 'old man', liberation from death/sin, and eternal joy.
tekstueel_bewijs: renew the old man in us
our sins are forgiven, and our chains shattered
This is the day the Lord has made
his Father’s throne quivered for joy

ontvanger.identificatie: The Good Thief, the dead, the Church, the 'old man' in the believer.
tekstueel_bewijs: the Good Thief has entered into heaven
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the Receiver (the one being renewed/liberated).

helper.identificatie: Sacraments (living water/altar), Angels, and the Innocence of the Redeemer.
tekstueel_bewijs: emerged from the source of living water purified
Because of our Redeemer’s innocence, he merited salvation
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject, and Christ's humanity/innocence acts as the Helper/Mediator.
helper.rol_van_geest: External help through 'spiritual light' and 'living water'.

tegenstander.identificatie: Death, Hell, The Accuser (Satan), Sin, and the 'Old Law'.
tekstueel_bewijs: the chains of hell have burst asunder
the father of lies lost his case
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponents are ontological and spiritual powers (Hell, Death, the Devil) that no human effort could overcome.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The ethical response of the believer: celebrating with internal qualities rather than external show.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer / The Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Qualities of mind and heart / Perseverance in love.
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The ethical response (shining with qualities) is a result of the 'day God has made' and the 'chains being shattered'.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.subject_naar_object: Christ → Breaking the chains of Hell

voorbeelden_god_subject: God has taken care to raise the dead
the Lord of the angels has risen
Jesus’ death tore the Temple veil
voorbeelden_mens_subject: we shall go to our holy mother

voorbeelden: he should shine forth due to his qualities
Let no one ever again desire earthly bread
dispelling the clouds which had prevented them from seeing the truth
the dead have become alive again
the captives felt their chains slip off

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is dominated by the 'Power' of God to change the state of the Subject. It is not about what we must do, but what has been enabled and done for us.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Hell/Chains) through ~S2 (Liability canceled) to S1 (Dazzling light).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by Christ's physical and cosmic action (tearing the veil, bursting chains).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; S2 is described as 'chains of hell' and 'the valley of the shadow of death'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is overwhelmingly theocentric. God/Christ is the primary actor in almost every paragraph. Human action is framed as a 'rejoicing response' to a completed divine work.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: shine forth due to his qualities of mind and heart

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God has taken care to raise the dead and renew the old man in us
the chains of hell have burst asunder

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures (Good Thief, Apostles) are used as fellow-receivers of grace, not as moral models to emulate through effort.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already treats them theocentrically.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The narrative flows perfectly from the cosmic event (Resurrection) to the sacramental reality (Baptism/Church) to the personal response (Joy).
spanning_punten: The transition from 'chains of hell' to 'chains of each and every sin' bridges the cosmic and the personal.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: the chains of hell have burst asunder... the calumniator fled

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is implied in the 'spiritual light' and 'living water' that purifies and renews.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is seen as 'chains' and 'liability to punishment' under a 'calumniator'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is a textbook example of a Grace-oriented structure where God is the Subject and the human is the joyful Receiver.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; appropriate for an Easter sermon.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: Strongly defined as Hell and the Accuser.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon masterfully maintains God as the Subject of the active verbs of salvation, creating a truly evangelical (Good News) atmosphere.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While rhetoric would focus on the repetitive use of 'This is the day', semiotics reveals that 'The Day' is actually an actant representing the Object of God's creative power.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would explain the context of Ps 117; semiotics shows how the preacher uses the Psalm to shift the hearer from a state of 'Lack' to 'Fullness'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas' model highlights that the 'Opponent' is not just human failure but a legal/cosmic 'Accuser' who loses a 'case', emphasizing the forensic nature of the grace described.

appendices.notnotes: The sermon uses the 'Axis of Transmission' effectively to pass the value of the 'Day' from the Sender (God) to the Receiver (The Church).
